channel.title: Can't Host Server. Tried Everything (literally?) Help highly appreciated
channel.description:
So heres the deal guys. I have tried EVERYTHING to host a server. I know most people can create a no-ip, get the server they want, compile it, run it, and its all working nice. Thats not the deal with me, i have wanted to host for a very long time but haven't been able to because of a major problem. My router. My router has prevented me from hosting for the longest time. Help would be highly appreciated if you could help me out with hosting with a router. Router: Linksys
I have tried creating static ip's, forwarding ports, all sorts of stuff. If anyone knows the straightforward solution or something thats not along those lines that could allow me to finally host a server many thanks would be given.
EDITING: STEPS I HAVE DONE TO HELP EVERYONE KNOW.
1) created a No-Ip. 2)Read a Tutorial on how to create a static IP. 3) Created a static IP (control panel, connections, local area, changed from automatically obtain to static) 4) STATIC IP WAS SUCCESSFUL (internet still worked) 5) Logged into my router. 6)Clicked gaming tab or w\e. 7) Named application Mopar... opened ports ranging from 5555-43954 , checked the "on" so its on. 8) Tried it out, had a few friends try to get on through my no-ip and regular ip. 9) to no prevail, they couldn't login and I'm here now typing this.

item.title: Can't Host Server. Tried Everything (literally?) Help highly appreciated
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

I saw your problem on hosting a server, all you have to do is on your linksys router, click applications and gaming, for port range put your server port in both of them, then for the protocal put it on both, then for the empty spot at the end of the thing, put that last 1,2 or 3 digits in your ip, go to start > run > type cmd then type ipconfig, and its the “ip address”, then create a no-ip and download the no-ip DUCT and click on your ip so its a smiley face, then run your server and wala!

Read full topic

item.title: Can't Host Server. Tried Everything (literally?) Help highly appreciated
item.dc:creator: @EazyE EazyE
item.description:
@EazyE wrote:

  1. Once your at your firewall, clicked the exceptions tab and you can add a port. Name it moparscape (or whatever you want) and make it port 43594. Leave it as port TCP.
  2. According to that guy it needs to be a laptop. I have no idea, i dont have a regular pc to test it out on.
  3. Once you go to portforward. Choose your router, and itll tell you to make a Static IP. Itll say click here if you dont have one. Click there, and its a step by step process on how to create it.

Read full topic

item.source: Can't Host Server. Tried Everything (literally?) Help highly appreciated

item.title: Can't Host Server. Tried Everything (literally?) Help highly appreciated
item.dc:creator: @EazyE EazyE
item.description:
@EazyE wrote:

First you need to make a static ip.
(www.portforward.com) has the tutorial. (choose your router)

Then, you need to follow portforwards guide to portforwarding.
Once you have done both of those, go Start> Control panel> security center. Add your port to the list of accepted ports. Turn off your firewall.
Turn off any other firewalls from anti virus protection.

That worked for me.

Read full topic

item.source: Can't Host Server. Tried Everything (literally?) Help highly appreciated

item.title: Can't Host Server. Tried Everything (literally?) Help highly appreciated
item.dc:creator: @n0va_k0 n0va k0
item.description:
@n0va_k0 wrote:

I’ll tell you every single thing I did to get my server working
downloaded jdk6u2 did path specified thing
downloaded source
opened port 43594 through firewall and checked TCP
Turned firewall off
Made static ip then everything you did on your default gateway on address bar
On application and gaming, for ip address I put my static ip
downloaded no-ip and I have checked the ip I want to use with the smiley blushed
Using laptop
Checked on start>run>cmd>ipconfig/all to see if I had 2 DNS servers( 1 = you can’t portforward )

If that doesn’t work, just forget about the laptop and unplug everything to your router ( tell your parents before that because you may screw up your computer). Do everything you did on the laptop but without the router. It would lag more though

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @EazyE EazyE
item.description:
@EazyE wrote:

Ok, and i would never use hamachi haha[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 15, 2008, 05:36:39 PM[/size][hr]Still didnt work, and i also turned off every firewall i have.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 15, 2008, 05:41:34 PM[/size][hr]OMG I FINALLY GOT IT TO WORK.!!!

From static ips, forwarding ports, lowering all firewalls, and using my ip instead of no-ip… my friend could login.

Thanks everyone. And nova, im sorry for getting mad at you i was just really frustrated.

Now i gotta figure out what went wrong with no-ip >.<

Read full topic
